{"blocks":[{"key":"65phr","text":"The limit of detection (LOD_95) is the genome copy number/uL and associated Ct value at which a qPCR amplification would be observed 95% of the time. This can be calculated from the results of the dilution series using PROBIT analysis. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f191i","text":"To calculate the GC/uL from the qPCR Ct values of actual samples you can use the equation: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8hhgl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"257hr","text":"log GC/uL = (Ct – intercept) / slope","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e6kao","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aplol","text":"where slope and intercept are from the linear regression of the Ct value on log GC/uL generated from the standard curves (e.g. as given in the Excel spreadsheet or from the linear model (lm) fit in R).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"19f8k","text":"For example, performing four replicates of 12 dilutions three times on three separate days. This would be two plates each day to include all targets.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"7u43u","text":"The following protocol is optimized for the detection of Salmonella Paratyphi A and Vibrio cholerae using multiplex qPCR assays from TNA extracted from environmental samples (wastewater samples). Total Nucleic Acid (TNA) extracted from the pellet particles is used as template in a real-time PCR assay which uses primer-probes specific for Salmonella Paratyphi A or Vibrio cholerae gene targets. Three different multiplex PCR assays were designed following standardization and validation of the primer probe combinations. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":57,"length":10},{"style":"italic","offset":84,"length":15},{"style":"italic","offset":340,"length":11},{"style":"italic","offset":366,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"as45c","text":"This protocol describes qPCR based detection of Salmonella Paratyphi \"A\" and Vibrio cholerae gene targets in three PCR panels from TNA extraction of processed environmental samples that were spiked with internal controls (SPC EGT control DNA - referenced below) . Additionally, HF183 which serves as a marker of fecal contamination in environmental samples, is included in the qPCR assays. Due to the similarity in cycling conditions, these assays can be conducted simultaneously for a sample as three distinct panels.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":48,"length":11},{"style":"italic","offset":77,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"804hk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fiq8a","text":"The positive controls (PCs) used here are linear oligos (gBlocks) that have been used in generating standard curves. Ideally the concentration of PCs used should yield Ct values that fall in the linear phase of the amplification curve.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c22e7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"63fjm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1du53","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1gfoj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6p7sr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":95504,"title":"Extraction of Total Nucleic Acid from Environmental Samples for the Detection of Bacterial and Viral Targets","title_html":"Extraction of Total Nucleic Acid from Environmental Samples for the Detection of Bacterial and Viral Targets","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"extraction-of-total-nucleic-acid-from-environmenta-c9hqz35w","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Dilip Abraham","affiliation":"CMC Vellore","affiliation_url":"https://www.cmch-vellore.edu/","username":"dilip-abraham1","link":"","image":{"source":"/img/avatars/002.png","placeholder":"/img/avatars/002.png","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":31},"type_id":1,"guid":"6E191ABE8E0042358B4652F383F88F59"}}}}
